alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 11:38PM MST until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Montana... Jefferson River near Three Forks affecting Broadwater and Gallatin Counties. Gallatin River at Logan affecting Gallatin County. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. For the Jefferson River...including DCP-Twin Bridges, Three Forks... elevated river levels are forecast. For the Gallatin River...including DCP-Gallatin R/Gateway, Logan... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Gallatin River at Logan. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.7 feet...water can flood farm field next to river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM MST Tuesday, the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to remain near flood stage over the next few days. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 1100 PM MST.
